arts.ttl: Nathan Jones praises Gassan Ahadme double and says Matty Godden is answering questions raised by Alfie May departure
arts.sum: Ahadme, who has now scored three times in the competition to go with his solitary League One strike away at Shrewsbury, opened the scoring with an impressive header from Conor Coventry’s cross. He also nodded home Charlton’s third in the dying stages, extending the two-goal lead that Matty Godden’s eighth strike of the campaign had opened before the half-hour mark.

arts.ttl: Nathan Jones explains why Miles Leaburn sat out Charlton win at Walsall - and gives positive update on another absentee
arts.sum: Nathan Jones revealed why Miles Leaburn sat out of Charlton’s 4-0 win at Walsall in the FA Cup – and gave a positive update on another Addicks absentee. Jones, when asked about his forward’s absence, said: “He came off the back of a big injury.

arts.ttl: The lowdown on Walsall 0 Charlton Athletic 4 - Addicks march into FA Cup third round with comprehensive win
arts.sum: Charlton Athletic: Maynard-Brewer, Gillesphey, A Mitchell, Edwards, Edmonds-Green, Coventry (A Campbell 88), Berry (T Campbell 63), Taylor, Godden (Small 63), Ahadme (Hylton 88), Anderson (Laqeretabua 89). Charlton remain on course to replicate their famous 1947 FA Cup win after a thumping 4-0 win at League Two Walsall.

arts.ttl: Charlton thump Walsall to reach FA Cup third round
arts.sum: Watch highlights as Charlton Athletic 'make light work' of League Two opponents Walsall, winning 4-0 away in the second round of the FA Cup.

arts.ttl: Saturday's FA Cup predictions including Walsall vs. Charlton Athletic
arts.sum: Sports Mole provides score predictions and previews for all of today's FA Cup fixtures, including Walsall vs. Charlton Athletic.

arts.ttl: Preview: Walsall vs. Charlton Athletic - prediction, team news, lineups
arts.sum: Sports Mole previews Saturday's FA Cup clash between Walsall and Charlton Athletic, including predictions, team news and possible lineups.

arts.ttl: Charlton Athletic boss confirms defender is on “horrific” injury list and discusses Jamaican attacker’s first-team credentials
arts.sum: “We have six or seven, at least, young players who have come through the academy and people like Thierry Small, who is 19-20 years of age, all in our first-team squad. “We prepare the same way (for league and cup matches),” said Jones.
